entry.title: Last chances and second glances
entry.summary:
Author: thebookofcrows

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 162,537Chapters: 48/60Kudos: 862

Summary: St. Anthony‚Äôs was his last chance, and Evan knew that. He had been kicked out of five schools in the past six years, and after his sophomore year ended with a meeting between his parents and his last headmaster that could be summarized with: ‚Äúwe‚Äôre not kicking him out, but just know that Evan is not welcome back in September.‚Äù His parents wanted to send him to military school. ¬† ¬† ¬† Evan knew he couldn‚Äôt survive military school, that would be his last drop, the one that finally shattered the vase. He couldn‚Äôt be the type of person that would be able to put himself back together once they broke him down. ¬† ¬† This had to work. . . . Buck is the new kid in an El Paso boarding school, trying his best to stay out of trouble. Eddie is a rockstar (in the world of high school popularity) he's captain to the football team, he's dating the most popular girl in school, and looking at a full ride sports scholarship in the fall. He should feel like he won at life, which is why he doesn't understand why the only time he feels alive is when he catches a glimpse of the new guy on the running team. Or in simpler terms: Buddie high-school AU!

entry.title: An Extinct Flower Blooms
entry.summary:
Author: bandhoez9194

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,292Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 33

Summary: 1819 Evan closed his eyes, a shimmer appearing to his fingers. A single seed was formed, a similar shimmer to its shell. Evan pressed it into the dirt, whispering under his breath. "When we meet again, this will bloom. I know you've done the ritual to let our souls be entwined for life. Souls are reborn into the bloodline, pass the flower down and tell our story," he said softly and Edmundo closed his eyes. ~ 2019 He looked at the dirt, picking up the spray bottle next to it and lightly moistening it. The dirt shifted, Eddie freezing. A tiny stem was poking through the dirt, a vivid green against the dark brown of the soil. He stumbled back away from the plant, his magic swirling in his chest elatedly. It bloomed, the fucking plant bloomed. He'd expected to have to pass it off to Chris, to tell the story he'd been told.

entry.summary:
Author: ThisB_tchEmpty

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,120Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 140

Summary: ‚ÄúI-‚Äù He starts, then stops with a tired sigh. Like he‚Äôs much too tired for all the emotions that it should bring up, and yet the words still struggle to find their way out. Still clog up his throat, and overtake his heart. Eddie hears him shuffle about, but he must just roll over because he doesn‚Äôt get any clearer. ‚ÄúI need you to be my best friend for a minute.‚Äù He finally murmurs. All sleep soft and honest. Eddie wants to ask what else he could be, if they really haven‚Äôt been on the same page with their relationship all these years. As if they haven‚Äôt intertwined every aspect of their lives from the moment they met. ‚ÄúAnd not the guy I‚Äôm in love with.‚Äù Oh. - OR Buck and Eddie late night phone confessions

entry.title: one single glimpse of relief
entry.summary:
Author: greyspilot

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 71,152Chapters: 13/20Kudos: 161

Summary: "What if I never get better? What if I always feel like this?" Buck finally looks back up at him, vulnerability and compassion clear on his too-expressive face. "I don't know," he says honestly. "I don't‚Ä¶" he shudders, gives a tiny shrug of his shoulders and tries again. "I don't have an answer for that, man. It's been seven months for me and I still feel‚Ä¶like this." "Like what?" Buck just shrugs again, then mumbles, "Not myself." And Eddie doesn't know what to say to that either, because this is the only version of Buck he's ever known.Or: Buck and Eddie meet at grief group.

entry.title: Two Conditions
entry.summary:
Author: Buddiesmutslut

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 64,407Chapters: 12/12Kudos: 286

Summary: "A now-familiar rage boils up in Eddie's chest, and he shakes out his limbs, baring his teeth in relief when they call his name again. He'd been slated for three fights tonight, and this is his last one. Sweat is rolling down his back, and his body is probably going to ache in the morning, but he can't feel any of it yet because of the adrenaline. Not only as he already fought twice tonight, he'd also won both matches, and he doesn't feel like stopping. His limbs are still loose, there's energy still sparking through his veins, and the fury that he's been trying to expel all night is still firmly settled behind his breastbone, tendrils winding up his throat as if to choke him. He almost feels bad for whoever he's about to climb into the ring with." Or, one night sets Eddie on a whole new path.
